conclusion: To determine the time at which the two waves meet, calculate the time it takes for each wave to reach the meeting point.
Wave source 1 is at x = -0.2 m.
Wave source 2 is at x = 1.2 m.
The meeting point is at x = 0.5 m.
Distance traveled by wave 1 is 0.5 m - (-0.2 m) = 0.7 m.
Distance traveled by wave 2 is 1.2 m - 0.5 m = 0.7 m.
The wave speed is given as 0.4 m/s.
Time for wave 1 to reach the meeting point is 0.7 m / 0.4 m/s = 1.75 s.
Time for wave 2 to reach the meeting point is 0.7 m / 0.4 m/s = 1.75 s.
Both waves travel the same distance to the meeting point and have the same speed, so they will meet at the same time.
The two waves meet at t = 1.75 s.
